results.title: Gold in the hills: a case study in market segmentation
results.creator_credit: Hal Trussell, Carol Dunn, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Coast Community College District
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Marketing / Coast Community College District”.
The Irvine Co. is one of the largest property developers in the United States. The success of their planned communities has depended on a careful study of the needs of different segments of the housing market and building to meet those needs. The program explores the history of the company and how it has adapted to changing economic situations in order to design communities which encourage people to live there all their lives, even though their needs change as they age.

results.title: Prophecy: a case study in marketing research
results.creator_credit: Linda Jassim, Carol Dunn, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Coast Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Marketing / Coast Community College District”.
The Disney Channel is shown consulting the marketing research company ASI to find out how best to place Disney in the cable TV market. Executives from the companies explain the four P’s of marketing - product, price, place, promotion - to be considered when planning a market strategy. Examples of different types of surveys and testing are shown, including phone surveys, focus groups and previews. There is a short explanation of how the data is tabulated, indexed, collated and evaluated, but it is stressed that, however valuable the research is, intuition and experience also play a major part.

results.title: Drugs and side effects
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit
results.brief_description: Designed to provide the intellectual disability care worker with an overview of drugs and society, the role of the careworker, the forms and administration of drugs, the most commonly prescribed drugs, non-prescription or over-the-counter drugs, and suggestions for teaching self administration. Accompanied by a 42p. in-service training manual.

results.title: Drugs - better dead?
results.brief_description: An undramatised documentary which shows the harrowing effects of drug misuse. Young addicts and ex-addicts give accounts of what life is like on various drugs, how they experience withdrawal symptoms and their need for more and more money to buy the drugs. Glimpses are seen of a post-mortem examination being conducted on the body of a young female addict.

results.title: Drinking driving surviving
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Greg Reading and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Alcohol plays an important part in our society as a relaxant and a status symbol, but when mixed with driving the results can be disastrous. This film explores the pressures to drink, the myths to which many Australians subscribe about drinking and driving, and the stark fact that alcohol, even in small amounts, seriously impairs driving

results.title: Drink no Longer Water
results.creator_credit: Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Fontana Films
results.brief_description: A humourous romp through various wine styles set in the country in a castle-like structure. Vignettes played out by actors - some in period costume to emulate the character of various wine varieties/styles from Moselle “for first lovers” through to claret are you old enough? Featuring Australian actors Steve Bisley and Mel Gibson in their youth.

results.title: A young girls journey to the other side of the world
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Maria Sourtzis
results.brief_description: This is a story of migration through the eyes of a young girl. Maria recounts the long journey by boat, the memories of Bonegilla migrant reception centre and her early life in Melbourne.
